citeinfo.title: Simla guide map (1972)
citeinfo.othercit: "Refer to this map as: 1:10,000 Simla guide map, first edition." Relief shown by 40 metre contour (contours are approximate) interval, and spot heights. Additions and alterations have been incorporated on the abasis of ground verification survey carried our during 1971." Inset masp: A map continuation; Mashobra (on the same scale); Continuation of Kasumpti (on the same scale); Simla neighbourhood (1:600,000), Ancillary map: Jutogh (on the same scale). Places of interest are listed and located.

descript.abstract: This is a map of the city of Simla, India, shown at a 1:10,000 scale. The map was created by the government-sponsored Survey of India.
descript.purpose: The purpose is to view the map in digital format.

idinfo.accconst: This is copyrighted material. To view the map in digital format you must visit the Map Room of the Geoscience Library. Contact information is included in this metadata.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.535

procstep.procdesc: This map was scanned with a Chroma Tx 40 Plus Wide Format color scanner and WIDEimage 2.8 software at 400 DPI in 24-bit color. The image was then reduced to 256 colors and saved in a TIFF file format. Later the TIFF image was compressed by the Mapping Science GeoJP2 software version 1.04.02. The compression ratio was 10:1.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
